pageTitle: At least Daily Express readers are still searching for Madeleine McCann

textBeforeTable: I got a little bit excited in April last year when they suddenly dropped 'Princess Diana' from the list. The script has been running for a year now, so I'm in a position to produce a table of the most popular search terms on the Daily Express website over the last 365 days. I know it is a little childish, but it just amuses me so much that they are obviously editorially chosen rather than a real reflection of what users are doing, and, more importantly, that they seldom ever change. I have a little Perl script that runs each morning, and checks what the popular searches are on the Daily Express website. Martin Belam, 15 February 2009  by At least Daily Express readers are still searching for Madeleine McCann digital media. journalism and IA, UX, Martin Belam’s blog about About Talks &
textAfterTable: So no one-track mind from the editorial team populating that search promo then! Incidentally, the blank space in my table isn't a mistake - for 202 days of the year the box had a random empty line in the middle and nobody seemed to notice... By Martin Belam on 15 February 2009. I’m the founder of Emblem, a digital consultancy offering user experience design, information architecture and training services. I’ve spent over a decade building products for brands like the Guardian, Sony, Vodafone and the BBC, and now work with clients in the publishing, media, arts, heritage and culture sectors.
